page.title: 02The Swyncombe Trust Farm.
page.content: The majority of the farmland belongs to the Trust and here the farming pattern has changed in the last year. Until autumn 1984 Coates Farm was on lease and the other 4 farms were managed for the Estate. The Home Farm continues to be run by a farm manager and is mainly parkland put to sheep. The remaining land is now a farm share scheme. The owner provides the land and half the fixed costs and the farmer provides the other half plus the machinery and labour. The profits are shared. The land is all arable with barley pre- dominating; half the crop, approx. 300 acres, being winter barley, and the rest spring barley, winter wheat, rape and triticale (bearded wheat).Two men are employed and the harvesting machinery is owned by the farmer. The straw is burnt not baled. Contractors are used only for hedge-trimming.
